alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued September 15 at 9:59AM AKDT until September 17 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 10 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...South winds 45 to 60 mph with gusts up to 80 mph expected. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 10 AM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A potent storm system, the extra-tropical remnants of Typhoon Merbok, is expected to move from the Northern Pacific Thursday, through the Southern Bering Thursday night and Friday morning, and into the Northern Bering Sea late Friday into Saturday. Winds are expected to increase by late morning Friday and continue through Saturday morning before slowly diminishing Saturday night. The highest winds will be along the coast to the east of the Kuskokwim Delta and over Nunivak Island, where gusts to 80 mph will be likely. Farther inland, sustained winds are expected to be around 45 mph with gusts to 60 mph.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
